oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Robert E. Lee doll
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Robert E. Lee commanded the Army of Northern Virginia until early in 1865 when he was promoted to General-in-Chief of the Confederacy. Lee surrendered the Army of Northern Virginia to Ulysees S. Grant at Appomatox Court House on April 9, 1865. Pro-Confederate Southerners idolized Lee during and after the Civil War as a symbol of Southern virtue. The doll was made between 1870-1890 and has a handmade hat, coat, vest, and watch fob. The papiermache' face was handpainted.
